alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 12:32PM AKST until January 10 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches or higher possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The northeast Gulf Coast, Glacier Bay, Misty Fjords, the eastern Gulf Coast, and portions of the central Inner Channels including Juneau, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, Gustavus, Yakutat, Pelican, Elfin Cove, and Hyder. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Slippery conditions will develop. Heavy, wet snow will be difficult to manage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow may transition or change to rain early Monday. Heavy rain over deep snow could challenge roof- tops, decks, and boats with extremely heavy loads. Pay close attention to your local avalanche forecast especially for those near steep terrain. With rain over deep snowpack, flooding is also a concern for next week.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
